p: In the essential oil of wild-growing H. officinalis subsp. aristatus (aerial parts) native to Italy, the main compound was linalool (35.3–51.2%), whereas methyl eugenol (7.3–22.7%), limonene (3.7–4.4%), germacrene D (1.9–4.1%), ( Z)- β-ocimene (5.1–5.8%) and ( E)- β-ocimene (2.1–5.3%) were reported as well [ 5].
